result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David S Stelmack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David S Stelmack in court with attorney Brian P. Dimmer.  Defendant David S Stelmack in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
On a plea to count 1 in 14CF1392, state moves to dismiss count 2 and DRI 15CM31.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - Dismissed.  15CM31 - DRI. 
BTC: PSI ordered. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant. QR   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David S Stelmack in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant David S Stelmack in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
